1250964814.excerpt: In Brief Exactly 100 years ago a comet or an asteroid exploded a few kilometers above the Tunguska region of central Siberia, leaving a huge zone of destruction. Despite many searches, no one has found any remnant of the impact body.

3802003775.resolved_title: Avenging Billy: How amateur sleuths took on a gay porn actor’s haunting Hollywood murder
3802003775.excerpt: The first time most people in Los Angeles heard of gay porn actor Billy London — a.k.a. Bill Newton — was when his head and feet showed up in a dumpster.

3522663670.excerpt: June 8, 1708 the count of Casa Alegre knew a squadron of English warships was lurking in the area, but he thought he could avoid it.

3489061579.excerpt: In the mid-sixties, Candace Mossler was one of the most widely known socialites in Houston. She was in her forties, vivacious and full of charm, with wavy blond hair, deep-blue eyes, and a surgically enhanced figure that was often remarked upon in the many newspaper columns written about her.

2.credit: Courtesy of close relations of Candace Mossler
2.caption: Candace and Jacques in the early fifties.

3.caption: Candace and Jacques arriving with their four adopted children at Houston International Airport in 1957.

4.credit: Courtesy of close relations of Candace Mossler
4.caption: Candace vacationing with the kids in Florida in 1964.

5.caption: Candace walking to a Miami courtroom in 1966.

6.caption: Mel Powers with attorney Percy Foreman in a Miami courtroom on February 10, 1966.

7.caption: Candace and Mel leaving the courthouse in a convertible with their lawyers.

8.caption: Candace and Mel at a press conference following the murder trial, with Candace’s children behind them.

9.caption: A press photo announcing Candace’s marriage to her third husband, Barnett Garrison.

10.credit: Courtesy of close relations of Candace Mossler
10.caption: Candace

11.caption: Candace’s graveside service at Arlington National Cemetery, in 1976.

3450620857.excerpt: She was a pretty girl, thin, with a spray of pale freckles across her face and light brown hair that curled just above her shoulders. The librarian at the high school called her “a quiet-type person,” the kind of student who yes-ma’amed and no-ma’amed her teachers.

2.caption: Before she left her home in 1985, Treva appeared to be a typical, happy teenager– she worked at a Whistle Stop and was friendly, polite, and energetic.

3.caption: She liked playing on the tennis team, even though she rarely won.

4.caption: Brianna was known for her overalls and pigtails.

5.caption: At the Sadie Hawkins dance, Ken told her that he loved her.

6.caption: Her handwritten poetry, however, revealed her private feelings of despair.

7.caption: Treva at about the age of fourteen or fifteen.

8.caption: In 1998, Brianna wore a dress to Evergreen High School's homecoming that her boyfriend's mother had made.

9.caption: After Treva graduated from high school in 1987, she had hoped to enroll at a Bible college, but that never happened.

10.caption: At her trial last November in Vancouver, Brianna had no choice but to come face-to-face with the truth about Treva.

3426535014.excerpt: One morning this past September, Mrs. Mary Scott walked out of her tiny brick house, one hand clutching a plastic tub of birdseed, the other holding on to the front door in case she lost her balance.

2.caption: Wayne Henley, one of Corll’s teenage accomplices, is escorted into a Houston courtroom to face murder charges.

8.caption: Workers unearth bodies at the storage shed that Corll rented.   AP

9.caption: Sheriff’s deputies display a torture board that Corll had rigged up for his victims, along with other implements he used in the murders.   AP

10.caption: Mrs. Mary Scott in the house in the Heights that her family owned when her son Mark disappeared on April 20, 1972.

11.caption: Starting in 2006 forensic anthropologist Sharon Derrick began identifying the remaining bodies from the killings.

2766302858.resolved_title: The ghostly radio station that no one claims to run
2766302858.excerpt: “MDZhB” has been broadcasting since 1982. No one knows why. BBC Future has brought you in-depth and rigorous stories to help you navigate the current pandemic, but we know that’s not all you want to read. So now we’re dedicating a series to help you escape.

2628984132.resolved_title: What Really Happened to Malaysia’s Missing Airplane
2628984132.excerpt: Five years ago, the flight vanished into the Indian Ocean. Officials on land know more about why than they dare to say. Updated at 10:25 a.m. ET on June 17, 2019.

2.caption: Left: The Malaysian lawyer and activist Grace Subathirai Nathan, whose mother was on board MH370. Right: Blaine Gibson, an American who has mounted a search for debris from the airplane.

5.caption: The first scrap of debris found by Blaine Gibson, from a horizontal-stabilizer panel, was recovered on a sandbank off the coast of Mozambique in February 2016.

2306018487.resolved_title: Mystery of the cargo ships that sink when their cargo suddenly liquefies
2306018487.excerpt: Think of a dangerous cargo and toxic waste or explosives might come to mind. But granular cargoes such as crushed ore and mineral sands are responsible for the loss of numerous ships every year. On average, ten “solid bulk cargo” carriers have been lost at sea each year for the last decade.

2.caption: A cargo ship being loaded with bauxite. Shutterstock

1059962512.resolved_title: An abandoned lifeboat at world’s end
1059962512.excerpt: Breaking news: a credible solution to the Bouvet Island lifeboat mystery has been found. See comments for 22-27 May 2011, 12 November 2011, 17-20 March and 9 April 2016. There is no more forbidding place on earth.

1.caption: The unidentified whaler or ship’s lifeboat found abandoned on Bouvet Island on 2 April 1964

2.caption: Bouvet Island: “A speck of ice in the middle of a freezing fastness: a few square miles of uninhabited volcanic basalt groaning under several hundred feet of glacier, scraped raw by gales, shrouded by drifts of sea-fog, and utterly devoid of trees, shelter, or landing places.” Photo: François Guerraz.

3.caption: Sea-cliffs on the north coast of Bouvet Island.

4.caption: Map of Bouvet Island as it is today. The Nyrøysa, where the mysterious lifeboat was discovered, can be seen on the north-west portion of the coast. Click to enlarge

5.caption: Geological map of the Nyrøysa by Peter Baker. The lifeboat was found in the larger and most northerly of the two small lagoons

6.caption: Stranded on Elephant Island, Ernest Shackleton’s men construct a shelter from a pair of boats, 1916. They survived in this accommodation for more than four months

7.caption: A landing party from the Transvaal goes ashore on the east coast of Bouvet Island, January 1955. The man in the officer’s cap is Allan Crawford, who discovered the abandoned lifeboat on the far side of the island nine years later

8.caption: The Soviet icebreaker Ob’ in the Antarctic, c.1958

3356592602.given_title: Decades After Mysteriously Drowning, Pecos Jane Has a Name – Texas Monthly
3356592602.excerpt: Sandy Moore spotted them lounging in plastic chairs by the Ropers Motel pool. The husband was drinking beer, the wife sipping soda. The young woman had long, dark hair. Her full lips and olive skin, set off by a red one-piece bathing suit, gave her a slightly Mediterranean look.

1.caption: Ropers Motel, in Pecos, on June 8, 2021.

2.caption: Police chief Lisa Tarango at Fairview Cemetery, where Pecos Jane was interred.

3.caption: Locals chipped in to buy the headstone marking Pecos Jane’s longtime resting place, which is lit at night by a ring of solar lamps.

5.caption: Joyce Hemmy in St. Petersburg, Florida, on June 19, 2021.

7.caption: The mystery of how Jolaine Hemmy ended up at the Ropers Motel may never be solved.

8.caption: The Ropers Motel pool, where Jolaine Hemmy drowned, was long ago filled in with dirt and chunks of concrete.

3338334522.given_title: DNA Could Identify Somerton Man Exhumed in Australia - The New York Times
3338334522.resolved_title: Australia Exhumes the Somerton Man, and His 70-Year Mystery
3338334522.excerpt: No one knows how the so-called Somerton man, found well-dressed and dead with a half-smoked cigarette on his lapel, wound up on the beach in South Australia where he was found. No one knows what he was doing there, or even how he died.

3307045158.given_title: Out of thin air: the mystery of the man who fell from the sky | Air transpo
3307045158.resolved_title: Out of thin air: the mystery of the man who fell from the sky
3307045158.excerpt: It was Sunday 30 June 2019, a balmy summer’s afternoon, and Wil, a 31-year-old software engineer, was lounging on an inflatable airbed outside his house in Clapham, south-west London. He wore pyjamas and drank Polish beer.

3444607376.given_title: Searching for Mr. X - The Atavist Magazine
3444607376.excerpt: On a summer day in 1931, a man was found wandering South State Street in Jackson, Mississippi. He appeared to be lost. He was white, with gray hair and a thin, angular face.

355249642.excerpt: Each Friday, the staff at Strange Company HQ jump for joy when the Link Dump is finally ready to post! What the hell is the Disc of Sabu?

3640491086.given_title: Stranger Things: A Reading List of Unsolved Mysteries
3640491086.resolved_title: Stranger Things: A Reading List of Unsolved Mysteries
3640491086.excerpt: The first novel I ever wrote had a mystery at its heart: a disappearance. It was never explained. It didn’t involve any kind of crime. The disappeared never reappeared. The mystery just … was.

2669099994.given_title: The Bizarre Tale of a Cursed Russian Ghost Ship
2669099994.resolved_title: The Bizarre Tale of a Cursed Russian Ghost Ship
2669099994.excerpt: The Russian ship called the Ivan Vassili began its life in St. Petersburg in 1897, where it was built as a civilian steam freighter for the purpose of hauling freight across the Baltic Sea from Russia to the Gulf of Finland.

3857833516.given_title: The Elusive, Maddening Mystery of the Bell Witch - Atlas Obscura
3857833516.resolved_title: The Elusive, Maddening Mystery of the Bell Witch
3857833516.excerpt: Sometimes we don’t pay close enough attention to the stories we’re given. That, at least, is the message of many a ghost story.

1.caption: The particular target of the Bell Witch’s ire was John Bell, patriarch of the family.

2.caption: It was never clear if the Bell’s tormentor was a ghost, a witch, or an act of ventriloquism.

3.caption: The anxieties that fueled the Bell Witch legend are tied up with the American frontier, family, and straying from tradition.

3852602655.given_title: The Lost Music of Connie Converse
3852602655.resolved_title: The Lost Music of Connie Converse
3852602655.excerpt: In the 1950s, a young woman in Greenwich Village sat in her tiny kitchen with a guitar and a reel-to-reel recorder to commit to tape the songs she had written. Her voice was wistful and almost pleasantly secretarial—crystalline, plainspoken, a voice seasoned by proper diction.

2.caption: To Anyone Who Ever Asks: The Life, Music, and Mystery of Connie ConverseBuy on BookshopDutton, 576 pp., $32.00

3.credit: Photograph  Richard Aime, courtesy of Lois Aime
3.caption: Converse regaling her friends the Ebys and Dick Aime with her musicPhotograph by Richard Aime, courtesy of Lois Aime

2303697984.given_title: The Mystery of People Who Speak Dozens of Languages | The New Yorker
2303697984.resolved_title: The Mystery of People Who Speak Dozens of Languages
2303697984.excerpt: Last May, Luis Miguel Rojas-Berscia, a doctoral candidate at the Max Planck Institute for Psycholinguistics, in the Dutch city of Nijmegen, flew to Malta for a week to learn Maltese. He had a hefty grammar book in his backpack, but he didn’t plan to open it unless he had to.

2.caption: “Unfortunately, a tiny percentage of the drones are opposed to violence.”

5.credit: Illustration  Oliver Munday; source photograph from Universal History Archive / Getty (face)
5.caption: One researcher of language acquisition describes her basic question as “How do I get a thought from my mind into yours?”Illustration by Oliver Munday; source photograph from Universal History Archive / Getty

2789298793.given_title: Viral Video Captures the Screams of a Mystery Creature - VICE
2789298793.resolved_title: Viral Video Captures the Screams of a Mystery Creature
2789298793.excerpt: A family from Ontario Canada was out hunting when they heard an eerie howling screaming in the distance. Smartphone in hand, they recorded the sounds. And a corner of the internet is convinced the now-viral video is evidence of Bigfoot.
